DESCRIPTOR.LABEL: GSC MIxS agriculture
DESCRIPTOR.NAME: GSC MIxS agriculture
DESCRIPTOR.DESCRIPTION: Genomic Standards Consortium package extension for reporting of measurements and observations obtained from the environment where the sample was obtained. By choosing the environmental package, a selection of fields can be made from a relevant subsets of the GSC terms.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Organism characteristics: ecosystem
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: ecosystem and relationships ( Organism characteristics got too big)

FIELD.LABEL: biotic relationship [deprecated]
FIELD.NAME: biotic relationship [deprecated]
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: free text description of relationship(s) between the subject organism and other organism(s) it is associate with, e.g., parasite on species X; mutualist with species Y, the target organism is the subject of the relationship, and the other organism(s) is the object

FIELD.LABEL: trophic level
FIELD.NAME: trophic level
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Trophic levels are the feeding position in a food chain. Microbes can be a range of producers (e.g. chemolithotroph)

FIELD.LABEL: known pathogenicity
FIELD.NAME: known pathogenicity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: To what is the entity pathogenic, for instance plant, fungi, bacteria

FIELD.LABEL: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.NAME: relationship to oxygen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Is this organism an aerobe, anaerobe? Please note that aerobic and anaerobic are valid descriptors for microbial environments

FIELD.LABEL: propagation
FIELD.NAME: propagation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type of reproduction from the parent stock. Values for this field is specific to different taxa. For phage or virus: lytic/lysogenic/temperate/obligately lytic. For plasmids: incompatibility group. For eukaryotes: sexual/asexual. Mandatory for MIGs of eukayotes, plasmids and viruses.

FIELD.LABEL: observed host symbionts
FIELD.NAME: observed host symbionts
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The taxonomic name of the organism(s) found living in mutualistic, commensalistic, or parasitic symbiosis with the specific host.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection: methods, storage and transport
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: sample collection: methods, storage and transport (sample collection became unmanageable)

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection device
FIELD.NAME: sample collection device
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The device used to collect an environmental sample. It is recommended to use terms listed under environmental sampling device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO) and/or terms listed under specimen collection device (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0002094).

FIELD.LABEL: sample collection method
FIELD.NAME: sample collection method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The method employed for collecting the sample. Can be provided in the form of a PMID, DOI, url or text.

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage temperature
FIELD.NAME: sample storage temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80

FIELD.LABEL: sample storage location
FIELD.NAME: sample storage location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room. Indicate the location name.

FIELD.LABEL: size-fraction lower threshold
FIELD.NAME: size-fraction lower threshold
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Refers to the mesh/pore size used to retain the sample. Materials smaller than the size threshold are excluded from the sample

FIELD.LABEL: size-fraction upper threshold
FIELD.NAME: size-fraction upper threshold
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Refers to the mesh/pore size used to pre-filter/pre-sort the sample. Materials larger than the size threshold are excluded from the sample

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions: soil
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: local environment conditions: soil (as local environment conditions grew too large)

FIELD.LABEL: soil_taxonomic/FAO classification
FIELD.NAME: soil_taxonomic/FAO classification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: soil classification from the FAO World Reference Database for Soil Resources

FIELD.LABEL: soil_taxonomic/local classification
FIELD.NAME: soil_taxonomic/local classification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: soil classification based on local soil classification system

FIELD.LABEL: soil_taxonomic/local classification method
FIELD.NAME: soil_taxonomic/local classification method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining the local soil classification

FIELD.LABEL: soil type
FIELD.NAME: soil type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of the soil type or classification. This field accepts terms under soil (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00001998). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: soil type method
FIELD.NAME: soil type method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification

FIELD.LABEL: soil texture measurement
FIELD.NAME: soil texture measurement
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil, as described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g., silty clay loam) optional.

FIELD.LABEL: soil texture method
FIELD.NAME: soil texture method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining soil texture

FIELD.LABEL: soil pH
FIELD.NAME: soil pH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: pH measurement of the soil; e.g. 6.2

FIELD.LABEL: soil cover
FIELD.NAME: soil cover
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of the material covering the sampled soil. This field accepts terms under ENVO:00010483, environmental material.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection: core sample properties

FIELD.LABEL: oxygenation status of sample
FIELD.NAME: oxygenation status of sample
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: oxygenation status of sample

FIELD.LABEL: microbial biomass
FIELD.NAME: microbial biomass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 µm. IF you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units, which should be mg C (or N)/kg soil).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms: study or project

FIELD.LABEL: project name
FIELD.NAME: project name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the project within which the sequencing was organized

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: food and agriculture: farm

FIELD.LABEL: farm equipment sanitization
FIELD.NAME: farm equipment sanitization
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Method used to sanitize growing and harvesting equipment. This can including type and concentration of sanitizing solution. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: equipment shared with other farms
FIELD.NAME: equipment shared with other farms
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: List of planting, growing or harvesting equipment shared with other farms. This field accepts terms listed under agricultural implement (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00000416). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: farm equipment used
FIELD.NAME: farm equipment used
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: List of equipment used for planting, fertilization, harvesting, irrigation, land levelling, residue management, weeding or transplanting during the growing season. This field accepts terms listed under agricultural implement (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00000416). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: farm watering water source
FIELD.NAME: farm watering water source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Source of water used on the farm for irrigation of crops or watering of livestock.

FIELD.LABEL: food production system characteristics
FIELD.NAME: food production system characteristics
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Descriptors of the food production system or of the agricultural environment and growing conditions related to the farm production system, such as wild caught, organic, free-range, industrial, dairy, beef, domestic or cultivated food production. This field accepts terms listed under food production (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03530206). Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: animal water delivery method
FIELD.NAME: animal water delivery method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of the equipment or method used to distribute water to livestock. This field accepts termed listed under water delivery equipment (http://opendata.inra.fr/EOL/EOL_0001653). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: plant water delivery method
FIELD.NAME: plant water delivery method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of the equipment or method used to distribute water to crops. This field accepts termed listed under irrigation process (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/AGRO_00000006). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: food harvesting process
FIELD.NAME: food harvesting process
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A harvesting process is a process which takes in some food material from an individual or community of plant or animal organisms in a given context and time, and outputs a precursor or consumable food product. This may include a part of an organism or the whole, and may involve killing the organism.

FIELD.LABEL: food production characteristics
FIELD.NAME: food production characteristics
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Descriptors of the food production system such as wild caught, free-range, organic, free-range, industrial, dairy, beef.

FIELD.LABEL: fertilizer administration date
FIELD.NAME: fertilizer administration date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Date of administration of soil amendment or fertilizer. Multiple terms may apply and can be separated by pipes, listing in reverse chronological order.

FIELD.LABEL: crop yield
FIELD.NAME: crop yield
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Amount of crop produced per unit or area of land.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: non-sample terms

FIELD.LABEL: ploidy
FIELD.NAME: ploidy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The ploidy level of the genome (e.g. allopolyploid, haploid, diploid, triploid, tetraploid). It has implications for the downstream study of duplicated gene and regions of the genomes (and perhaps for difficulties in assembly). For terms, please select terms listed under class ploidy (PATO:001374) of Phenotypic Quality Ontology (PATO), and for a browser of PATO (v 2018-03-27) please refer to http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: number of replicons
FIELD.NAME: number of replicons
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reports the number of replicons in a nuclear genome of eukaryotes, in the genome of a bacterium or archaea or the number of segments in a segmented virus. Always applied to the haploid chromosome count of a eukaryote. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes, bacteria, archaea and segmented virus.

FIELD.LABEL: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.NAME: extrachromosomal elements
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Do plasmids exist of significant phenotypic consequence (e.g. ones that determine virulence or antibiotic resistance). Megaplasmids? Other plasmids (borrelia has 15+ plasmids).

FIELD.LABEL: estimated size
FIELD.NAME: estimated size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The estimated size of the genome (in bp) prior to sequencing. Of particular importance in the sequencing of (eukaryotic) genome which could remain in draft form for a long or unspecified period. Mandatory for MIGS of eukaryotes.

FIELD.LABEL: target gene
FIELD.NAME: target gene
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Targeted gene or locus name for marker gene studies

FIELD.LABEL: target subfragment
FIELD.NAME: target subfragment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of subfragment of a gene or locus. Important to e.g. identify special regions on marker genes like V6 on 16S rRNA

FIELD.LABEL: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.NAME: multiplex identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Molecular barcodes, called Multiplex Identifiers (MIDs), that are used to specifically tag unique samples in a sequencing run. Sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: sequence quality check
FIELD.NAME: sequence quality check
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicate if the sequence has been called by automatic systems (none) or undergone a manual editing procedure (e.g. by inspecting the raw data or chromatograms). Applied only for sequences that are not submitted to SRA or DRA

FIELD.LABEL: chimera check software
FIELD.NAME: chimera check software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tool(s) used for chimera checking, including version number and parameters, to discover and remove chimeric sequences. A chimeric sequence is comprised of two or more phylogenetically distinct parent sequences.

FIELD.LABEL: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.NAME: relevant electronic resources
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise associated to the sequence in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.NAME: relevant standard operating procedures
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Standard operating procedures used in assembly and/or annotation of genomes, metagenomes or environmental sequences in the format of a PMID, DOI or URL

FIELD.LABEL: 16s recovered
FIELD.NAME: 16s recovered
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Can a 16S gene be recovered from the submitted bin, SAG or MAG?

FIELD.LABEL: 16S recovery software
FIELD.NAME: 16S recovery software
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Tools used for 16S rRNA gene extraction. Add names and versions of software(s), parameters used

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Collection event information

FIELD.LABEL: collection date
FIELD.NAME: collection date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The date the sample was collected with the intention of sequencing, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid ISO8601 compliant times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008.

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: (^[12][0-9]{3}(-(0[1-9]|1[0-2])(-(0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])(T[0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2}(:[0-9]{2})?Z?([+-][0-9]{1,2})?)?)?)?(/[0-9]{4}(-[0-9]{2}(-[0-9]{2}(T[0-9]{2}:[0-9]{2}(:[0-9]{2})?Z?([+-][0-9]{1,2})?)?)?)?)?$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)

FIELD.LABEL: altitude
FIELD.NAME: altitude
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The altitude of the sample is the vertical distance between Earth's surface above Sea Level and the sampled position in the air.

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: ((0|((0\.)|([1-9][0-9]*\.?))[0-9]*)([Ee][+-]?[0-9]+)?)|((^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$))

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (country and/or sea)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of where the sample was collected from, with the intention of sequencing, as defined by the country or sea name. Country or sea names should be chosen from the INSDC country list (http://insdc.org/country.html).

TEXT_VALUE.VALUE: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (latitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by latitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: (^[+-]?[0-9]+.?[0-9]{0,8}$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (longitude)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by longitude. The values should be reported in decimal degrees and in WGS84 system

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: (^[+-]?[0-9]+.?[0-9]{0,8}$)|(^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$)

FIELD.LABEL: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.NAME: geographic location (region and locality)
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the specific region name followed by the locality name.

FIELD.LABEL: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.NAME: broad-scale environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the major environmental system the sample or specimen came from. The system(s) identified should have a coarse spatial grain, to provide the general environmental context of where the sampling was done (e.g. in the desert or a rainforest). We recommend using subclasses of EnvO’s biome class: http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000428. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: local environmental context
FIELD.NAME: local environmental context
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the entity or entities which are in the sample or specimen’s local vicinity and which you believe have significant causal influences on your sample or specimen. We recommend using EnvO terms which are of smaller spatial grain than your entry for "broad-scale environmental context". Terms, such as anatomical sites, from other OBO Library ontologies which interoperate with EnvO (e.g. UBERON) are accepted in this field. EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS.

FIELD.LABEL: environmental medium
FIELD.NAME: environmental medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Report the environmental material(s) immediately surrounding the sample or specimen at the time of sampling. We recommend using subclasses of 'environmental material' (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00010483). EnvO documentation about how to use the field: https://github.com/EnvironmentOntology/envo/wiki/Using-ENVO-with-MIxS . Terms from other OBO ontologies are permissible as long as they reference mass/volume nouns (e.g. air, water, blood) and not discrete, countable entities (e.g. a tree, a leaf, a table top).

FIELD.LABEL: elevation
FIELD.NAME: elevation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The elevation of the sampling site as measured by the vertical distance from mean sea level.

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: ([+-]?(0|((0\.)|([1-9][0-9]*\.?))[0-9]*)([Ee][+-]?[0-9]+)?)|((^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$))

FIELD.LABEL: culture isolation date
FIELD.NAME: culture isolation date
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A culture isolation date is a date-time entity marking the end of a process in which a sample yields a positive result for the target microbial analyte(s) in the form of an isolated colony or colonies.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample collection

FIELD.LABEL: sieving
FIELD.NAME: sieving
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Collection design of pooled samples and/or sieve size and amount of sample sieved

FIELD.LABEL: microbial biomass method
FIELD.NAME: microbial biomass method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference or method used in determining microbial biomass

FIELD.LABEL: organism count
FIELD.NAME: organism count
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total cell count of any organism (or group of organisms) per gram, volume or area of sample, should include name of organism followed by count. The method that was used for the enumeration (e.g. qPCR, atp, mpn, etc.) Should also be provided. (example: total prokaryotes; 3.5e7 cells per ml; qpcr)

FIELD.LABEL: horizon method
FIELD.NAME: horizon method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference or method used in determining the horizon

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: unusual properties

FIELD.LABEL: extreme_unusual_properties/heavy metals
FIELD.NAME: extreme_unusual_properties/heavy metals
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: heavy metals present and concentrations of any drug used by subject and the frequency of usage; can include multiple heavy metals and concentrations

FIELD.LABEL: extreme_unusual_properties/heavy metals method
FIELD.NAME: extreme_unusual_properties/heavy metals method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining heavy metals

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Organism characteristics

FIELD.LABEL: plant structure
FIELD.NAME: plant structure
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: name of plant structure that the sample was obtained from; for Plant Ontology (PO) terms see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PO, e.g. petiole epidermis (PO_0000051); if an individual flower is sampled the sex of it can be recorded here

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host disorder

FIELD.LABEL: host disease status
FIELD.SYNONYM: health or disease status of specific host
FIELD.NAME: host disease status
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: list of diseases with which the host has been diagnosed; can include multiple diagnoses. The value of the field depends on host; for humans the terms should be chosen from DO (Disease Ontology) at http://www.disease-ontology.org, other hosts are free text

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host description

FIELD.LABEL: host common name
FIELD.NAME: host common name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: common name of the host, e.g. human

FIELD.LABEL: host age
FIELD.NAME: host age
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees

FIELD.LABEL: host taxid
FIELD.SYNONYM: host of the symbiotic host taxon id
FIELD.NAME: host taxid
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: NCBI taxon id of the host, e.g. 9606

FIELD.LABEL: host life stage
FIELD.NAME: host life stage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: description of life stage of host

FIELD.LABEL: host height
FIELD.NAME: host height
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the height of subject

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: ((0|((0\.)|([1-9][0-9]*\.?))[0-9]*)([Ee][+-]?[0-9]+)?)|((^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$))

FIELD.LABEL: host length
FIELD.NAME: host length
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the length of subject

FIELD.LABEL: host total mass
FIELD.NAME: host total mass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host

FIELD.LABEL: host phenotype
FIELD.NAME: host phenotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: phenotype of host. For Phenotypic quality Ontology (PATO) (v 2013-10-28) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/PATO

FIELD.LABEL: host scientific name
FIELD.NAME: host scientific name
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Scientific name of the natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which sample was obtained.

FIELD.LABEL: host subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.NAME: host subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Information about the genetic distinctness of the host organism below the subspecies level e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, variety, cultivar, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: link

FIELD.LABEL: link to climate information
FIELD.NAME: link to climate information
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: link to climate resource

FIELD.LABEL: link to classification information
FIELD.NAME: link to classification information
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: link to digitized soil maps or other soil classification information

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions

FIELD.LABEL: climate environment
FIELD.NAME: climate environment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: treatment involving an exposure to a particular climate; can include multiple climates

FIELD.LABEL: presence of pets, animals, or insects
FIELD.SYNONYM: presence of pets or farm animals
FIELD.NAME: presence of pets, animals, or insects
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The type and number of animals or insects present in the sampling space.

FIELD.LABEL: current vegetation
FIELD.NAME: current vegetation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: vegetation classification from one or more standard classification systems, or agricultural crop

FIELD.LABEL: gaseous environment
FIELD.NAME: gaseous environment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: use of conditions with differing gaseous environments; should include the name of gaseous compound, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple gaseous environment regimens

FIELD.LABEL: humidity
FIELD.NAME: humidity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: amount of water vapour in the air, at the time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: current vegetation method
FIELD.NAME: current vegetation method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in vegetation classification

FIELD.LABEL: seasonal environment
FIELD.NAME: seasonal environment
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: treatment involving an exposure to a particular season (e.g. winter, summer, rabi, rainy etc.)

FIELD.LABEL: soil horizon
FIELD.NAME: soil horizon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: specific layer in the land area which measures parallel to the soil surface and possesses physical characteristics which differ from the layers above and beneath

FIELD.LABEL: solar irradiance
FIELD.NAME: solar irradiance
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the amount of solar energy that arrives at a specific area of a surface during a specific time interval

FIELD.LABEL: drainage classification
FIELD.NAME: drainage classification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system

FIELD.LABEL: temperature
FIELD.NAME: temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: temperature of the sample at time of sampling

FIELD.LABEL: pH method
FIELD.NAME: pH method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: reference or method used in determining pH

FIELD.LABEL: slope gradient
FIELD.NAME: slope gradient
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: commonly called slope. The angle between ground surface and a horizontal line (in percent). This is the direction that overland water would flow. This measure is usually taken with a hand level meter or clinometer.

FIELD.LABEL: slope aspect
FIELD.NAME: slope aspect
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: the direction a slope faces. While looking down a slope use a compass to record the direction you are facing (direction or degrees); e.g., NW or 315°. This measure provides an indication of sun and wind exposure that will influence soil temperature and evapotranspiration.

FIELD.LABEL: profile position
FIELD.NAME: profile position
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: cross-sectional position in the hillslope where sample was collected.sample area position in relation to surrounding areas

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: concentration measurement

FIELD.LABEL: total organic carbon method
FIELD.NAME: total organic carbon method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference or method used in determining total organic carbon

FIELD.LABEL: total nitrogen content method
FIELD.NAME: total nitrogen content method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference or method used in determining the total nitrogen

FIELD.LABEL: total phosphate
FIELD.NAME: total phosphate
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total amount or concentration of phosphate

FIELD.LABEL: total nitrogen concentration
FIELD.NAME: total nitrogen concentration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Concentration of nitrogen (total). Total nitrogen concentration of water samples, calculated by: total nitrogen = total dissolved nitrogen + particulate nitrogen. Can also be measured without filtering, reported as nitrogen

FIELD.LABEL: total carbon
FIELD.NAME: total carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: total carbon content

FIELD.LABEL: total organic carbon
FIELD.NAME: total organic carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Definition for soil: total organic C content of the soil units of g C/kg soil. Definition otherwise: total organic carbon content

FIELD.LABEL: water pH
FIELD.NAME: water pH
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: pH measurement of the sample, or liquid portion of sample, or aqueous phase of the fluid.

FIELD.LABEL: photosynthetic activity method
FIELD.NAME: photosynthetic activity method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference or method used in measurement of photosythentic activity

FIELD.LABEL: photosynthetic activity
FIELD.NAME: photosynthetic activity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Measurement of photosythetic activity (i.e. leaf gas exchange / chlorophyll fluorescence emissions / reflectance / transpiration) Please also include the term method term detailing the method of activity measurement.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Pointer to physical material
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: References to sample or sample source material in physical resources

FIELD.LABEL: source material identifiers
FIELD.NAME: source material identifiers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A unique identifier assigned to a material sample (as defined by http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/materialSampleID, and as opposed to a particular digital record of a material sample) used for extracting nucleic acids, and subsequent sequencing. The identifier can refer either to the original material collected or to any derived sub-samples. The INSDC qualifiers /specimen_voucher, /bio_material, or /culture_collection may or may not share the same value as the source_mat_id field. For instance, the /specimen_voucher qualifier and source_mat_id may both contain 'UAM:Herps:14' , referring to both the specimen voucher and sampled tissue with the same identifier. However, the /culture_collection qualifier may refer to a value from an initial culture (e.g. ATCC:11775) while source_mat_id would refer to an identifier from some derived culture from which the nucleic acids were extracted (e.g. xatc123 or ark:/2154/R2).

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment history

FIELD.LABEL: history/previous land use
FIELD.NAME: history/previous land use
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: previous land use and dates

FIELD.LABEL: previous land use method
FIELD.NAME: previous land use method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Reference or method used in determining previous land use and dates

FIELD.LABEL: history/crop rotation
FIELD.NAME: history/crop rotation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: whether or not crop is rotated, and if yes, rotation schedule

FIELD.LABEL: history/agrochemical additions
FIELD.NAME: history/agrochemical additions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: addition of fertilizers, pesticides, etc. - amount and time of applications

FIELD.LABEL: history/tillage
FIELD.NAME: history/tillage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: note method(s) used for tilling

FIELD.LABEL: history/fire
FIELD.NAME: history/fire
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: historical and/or physical evidence of fire

FIELD.LABEL: history/flooding
FIELD.NAME: history/flooding
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: historical and/or physical evidence of flooding

FIELD.LABEL: history/extreme events
FIELD.NAME: history/extreme events
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: unusual physical events that may have affected microbial populations

FIELD.LABEL: mean seasonal humidity
FIELD.NAME: mean seasonal humidity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Average humidity of the region throughout the growing season.

FIELD.LABEL: mean seasonal temperature
FIELD.NAME: mean seasonal temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mean seasonal temperature

FIELD.LABEL: mean seasonal precipitation
FIELD.NAME: mean seasonal precipitation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The average of all seasonal precipitation values known, or an estimated equivalent value derived by such methods as regional indexes or Isohyetal maps.

FIELD.LABEL: season
FIELD.NAME: season
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The season when sampling occurred. Any of the four periods into which the year is divided by the equinoxes and solstices. This field accepts terms listed under season (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C94729).

FIELD.LABEL: mean annual precipitation
FIELD.NAME: mean annual precipitation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The average of all annual precipitation values known, or an estimated equivalent value derived by such methods as regional indexes or Isohyetal maps.

FIELD.LABEL: mean annual temperature
FIELD.NAME: mean annual temperature
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Mean annual temperature

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: host details

FIELD.LABEL: host genotype
FIELD.NAME: host genotype
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: observed genotype

FIELD.LABEL: host specificity or range
FIELD.NAME: host specificity or range
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The range and diversity of host species that an organism is capable of infecting, defined by NCBI taxonomy identifier.

FIELD.LABEL: host dry mass
FIELD.NAME: host dry mass
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of dry mass

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: treatment
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Details of a treatment regime with a treatment agent.

FIELD.LABEL: spike-in microbial strain
FIELD.NAME: spike-in microbial strain
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Taxonomic information about the spike-in organism(s) at the strain level. This field accepts terms under organism (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/NCIT_C14250). This field also accepts identification numbers from NCBI under https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy. Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: perturbation
FIELD.NAME: perturbation
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: experimental factor and block

FIELD.LABEL: negative control type
FIELD.NAME: negative control type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The substance or equipment used as a negative control in an investigation

FIELD.LABEL: positive control type
FIELD.NAME: positive control type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The substance, mixture, product, or apparatus used to verify that a process which is part of an investigation delivers a true positive.

FIELD.LABEL: experimental factor
FIELD.NAME: experimental factor
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Experimental factors are essentially the variable aspects of an experiment design which can be used to describe an experiment, or set of experiments, in an increasingly detailed manner. This field accepts ontology terms from Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO) and/or Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI). For a browser of EFO (v 2.95) terms, please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/EFO; for a browser of OBI (v 2018-02-12) terms please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/OBI. E.g. time series design [EFO:EFO_0001779]

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Organism characteristics: genetic
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: The genetic based characteristics of organisms (Organism characteristics field group became too large)

FIELD.LABEL: encoded traits
FIELD.NAME: encoded traits
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Should include key traits like antibiotic resistance or xenobiotic degradation phenotypes for plasmids, converting genes for phage

FIELD.LABEL: genetic modification
FIELD.NAME: genetic modification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A genetic modification of the genome of an organism which may occur naturally by spontaneous mutation, or be introduced by some experimental means. Examples of genetic modification include specification of a transgene or the gene knocked-out or details of transient transfection.

FIELD.LABEL: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.NAME: subspecific genetic lineage
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Information about the genetic distinctness of the sequenced organism below the subspecies level, e.g., serovar, serotype, biotype, ecotype, or any relevant genetic typing schemes like Group I plasmid. Subspecies should not be recorded in this term, but in the NCBI taxonomy. Supply both the lineage name and the lineage rank separated by a colon, e.g., biovar:abc123.

FIELD.LABEL: ancestral data
FIELD.NAME: ancestral data
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about either pedigree or other description of ancestral information (e.g. parental variety in case of mutant or selection), e.g. A/3*B (meaning [(A x B) x B] x B)

FIELD.LABEL: taxonomic classification
FIELD.NAME: taxonomic classification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Method used for taxonomic classification, along with reference database used, classification rank, and thresholds used to classify new genomes. Expected values are: classification method, database name, and other parameters e.g. vConTACT vContact2 (references from NCBI RefSeq v83, genus rank classification, default parameters)

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: growth medium
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: specification of the substance where a plant sample has been grown

FIELD.LABEL: plant growth medium
FIELD.NAME: plant growth medium
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specification of the media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples, e.g. soil, aeroponic, hydroponic, in vitro solid culture medium, in vitro liquid culture medium. Recommended value is a specific value from EO:plant growth medium (follow this link for terms http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/EO_0007147).

FIELD.LABEL: rooting medium macronutrients
FIELD.NAME: rooting medium macronutrients
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: measurement of the culture rooting medium macronutrients (N,P, K, Ca, Mg, S); e.g. KH2PO4 (170mg/L)

FIELD.LABEL: rooting medium carbon
FIELD.NAME: rooting medium carbon
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: source of organic carbon in the culture rooting medium; e.g. sucrose

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Reference

FIELD.LABEL: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.NAME: isolation and growth condition
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Publication reference in the form of pubmed ID (pmid), digital object identifier (doi) or url for isolation and growth condition specifications of the organism/material. Mandatory for MIGS and MIMARKS Specimen.

FIELD.LABEL: annotation source
FIELD.NAME: annotation source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: For cases where annotation was provided by a community jamboree or model organism database rather than by a specific submitter

FIELD.LABEL: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.NAME: reference for biomaterial
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Primary publication if isolated before genome publication; otherwise, primary genome report. Mandatory for MIGS of bacteria and archaea.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: sample processing
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Any aspects collected about the processing of the sample once it has been collected. if the sample underwent cell lysis.

FIELD.LABEL: sequencing location
FIELD.NAME: sequencing location
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The location the sequencing run was performed. Indicate the name of the lab or core facility where samples were sequenced.

FIELD.LABEL: enrichment protocol
FIELD.NAME: enrichment protocol
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The microbiological workflow or protocol followed to test for the presence or enumeration of the target microbial analyte(s). Please provide a PubMed or DOI reference for published protocols.

FIELD.LABEL: library preparation kit
FIELD.NAME: library preparation kit
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Packaged kits (containing adapters, indexes, enzymes, buffers etc.), tailored for specific sequencing workflows, which allow the simplified preparation of sequencing-ready libraries for small genomes, amplicons, and plasmids.

FIELD.LABEL: sample pooling
FIELD.NAME: sample pooling
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Physical combination of several instances of like material, e.g. RNA extracted from samples or dishes of cell cultures into one big aliquot of cells. Please provide a short description of the samples that were pooled.

FIELD.LABEL: lot number
FIELD.NAME: lot number
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A distinctive alpha-numeric identification code assigned by the manufacturer or distributor to a specific quantity of manufactured material or product within a batch. Synonym: Batch Number. The submitter should provide lot number of the item followed by the item name for which the lot number was provided.

FIELD.LABEL: single cell or viral particle lysis approach
FIELD.NAME: single cell or viral particle lysis approach
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Method used to free DNA from interior of the cell(s) or particle(s)

FIELD.LABEL: single cell or viral particle lysis kit protocol
FIELD.NAME: single cell or viral particle lysis kit protocol
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Name of the kit or standard protocol used for cell(s) or particle(s) lysis

FIELD.LABEL: pooled DNA extract total
FIELD.NAME: pooled DNA extract total
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Indicate whether multiple DNA extractions were mixed. If the answer yes, the number of extracts that were pooled should be given. [ENA version of MIxS term: pooling of DNA extracts (if done). ]

FIELD.LABEL: sample material processing
FIELD.NAME: sample material processing
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A brief description of any processing applied to the sample during or after retrieving the sample from environment, or a link to the relevant protocol(s) performed.

FIELD.LABEL: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.NAME: sample volume or weight for DNA extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Volume (ml) or mass (g) of total collected sample processed for DNA extraction. Note: total sample collected should be entered under the term 'sample size'.

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid extraction
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the material separation to recover the nucleic acid fraction from a sample

FIELD.LABEL: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.NAME: nucleic acid amplification
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A link to a literature reference, electronic resource or a standard operating procedure (SOP), that describes the enzymatic amplification (PCR, TMA, NASBA) of specific nucleic acids

FIELD.LABEL: library size
FIELD.NAME: library size
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones in the library prepared for the project

FIELD.LABEL: library reads sequenced
FIELD.NAME: library reads sequenced
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Total number of clones sequenced from the library

FIELD.LABEL: library construction method
FIELD.NAME: library construction method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Library construction method used for clone libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library vector
FIELD.NAME: library vector
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Cloning vector type(s) used in construction of libraries

FIELD.LABEL: library screening strategy
FIELD.NAME: library screening strategy
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Specific enrichment or screening methods applied before and/or after creating clone libraries in order to select a specific group of sequences

FIELD.LABEL: pcr conditions
FIELD.NAME: pcr conditions
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of reaction conditions and components for PCR in the form of 'initial denaturation:94degC_1.5min; annealing=...'

FIELD.LABEL: pcr primers
FIELD.NAME: pcr primers
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: PCR primers that were used to amplify the sequence of the targeted gene, locus or subfragment. This field should contain all the primers used for a single PCR reaction if multiple forward or reverse primers are present in a single PCR reaction. The primer sequence should be reported in uppercase letters

FIELD.LABEL: adapters
FIELD.NAME: adapters
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Adapters provide priming sequences for both amplification and sequencing of the sample-library fragments. Both adapters should be reported; in uppercase letters

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: food and agriculture
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: food related from yield to food production, to agricultural machinery.

FIELD.LABEL: food shipping transportation vehicle
FIELD.NAME: food shipping transportation vehicle
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A descriptor for the mobile machine which is used to transport food commodities along the food distribution system. This field accepts terms listed under vehicle (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01000604). If the proper descrptor is not listed please use text to describe the mode of travel. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: water source shared
FIELD.NAME: water source shared
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Other users sharing access to the same water source. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: food source
FIELD.NAME: food source
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Type of plant or animal from which the food product or its major ingredient is derived or a chemical food source [FDA CFSAN 1995].

FIELD.LABEL: food shipping transportation method
FIELD.NAME: food shipping transportation method
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A descriptor for the method of movement of food commodity along the food distribution system. This field accepts terms listed under travel mode (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/GENEPIO_0001064). If the proper descrptor is not listed please use text to describe the mode of travel. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

FIELD.LABEL: food product type
FIELD.NAME: food product type
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: A food product type is a class of food products that is differentiated by its food composition (e.g., single- or multi-ingredient), processing and/or consumption characteristics. This does not include brand name products but it may include generic food dish categories. This field accepts terms under food product type (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON:03400361). For terms related to food product for an animal, consult food product for animal (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/FOODON_03309997). If the proper descriptor is not listed please use text to describe the food type. Multiple terms can be separated by one or more pipes.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: Environmental information
FIELD_GROUP.DESCRIPTION: Environmental information if not host associated.

FIELD.LABEL: relative location of sample
FIELD.NAME: relative location of sample
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Location of sampled soil to other parts of the farm e.g. under crop plant, near irrigation ditch, from the dirt road.

FIELD.LABEL: porosity
FIELD.NAME: porosity
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Porosity of deposited sediment is volume of voids divided by the total volume of sample

FIELD.LABEL: depth
FIELD.NAME: depth
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: The vertical distance below local surface, e.g. for sediment or soil samples depth is measured from sediment or soil surface, respectively. Depth can be reported as an interval for subsurface samples.

TEXT_FIELD.REGEX_VALUE: ((0|((0\.)|([1-9][0-9]*\.?))[0-9]*)([Ee][+-]?[0-9]+)?)|((^not collected$)|(^not provided$)|(^restricted access$)|(^missing: control sample$)|(^missing: sample group$)|(^missing: synthetic construct$)|(^missing: lab stock$)|(^missing: third party data$)|(^missing: data agreement established pre-2023$)|(^missing: endangered species$)|(^missing: human-identifiable$))

FIELD.LABEL: environment adjacent to site
FIELD.NAME: environment adjacent to site
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: Description of the environmental system or features that are adjacent to the sampling site. This field accepts terms under ecosystem (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_01001110) and human construction (http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ENVO_00000070). Multiple terms can be separated by pipes.

FIELD_GROUP.restrictionType: Any number or none of the fields
FIELD_GROUP.NAME: local environment conditions imposed

FIELD.LABEL: fungicide regimen
FIELD.NAME: fungicide regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving use of fungicides; should include the name of fungicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fungicide regimens

FIELD.LABEL: herbicide regimen
FIELD.NAME: herbicide regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving use of herbicides; information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of herbicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple regimens

FIELD.LABEL: non-mineral nutrient regimen
FIELD.NAME: non-mineral nutrient regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving the exposure of plant to non-mineral nutrient such as oxygen, hydrogen or carbon; should include the name of non-mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple non-mineral nutrient regimens

FIELD.LABEL: pesticide regimen
FIELD.NAME: pesticide regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving use of insecticides; should include the name of pesticide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple pesticide regimens

FIELD.LABEL: pH regimen
FIELD.NAME: pH regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of pH of the growth media; can include multiple regimen

FIELD.LABEL: salt regimen
FIELD.NAME: salt regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media; should include the name of salt, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple salt regimens

FIELD.LABEL: standing water regimen
FIELD.NAME: standing water regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water; can include multiple regimens

FIELD.LABEL: watering regimen
FIELD.NAME: watering regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving an exposure to watering frequencies; can include multiple regimens

FIELD.LABEL: water temperature regimen
FIELD.NAME: water temperature regimen
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: information about treatment involving an exposure to water with varying degree of temperature; can include multiple regimens

FIELD.LABEL: chemical administration
FIELD.NAME: chemical administration
FIELD.DESCRIPTION: list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. For Chemical Entities of Biological Interest ontology (CHEBI) (v111), please see http://purl.bioontology.org/ontology/CHEBI
